contents.title: Contents
contents.description: This guide will walk you through the process of setting up Dropdeck in your Shopify store. It will cover the basics of creating a preorder selling plan, and then how to set up your theme to use Dropdeck.

items.2: Setting up your theme to use Dropdeck
items.3: Installing code snippets for the advanced setup
items.4: Adding the Unit Restriction Checkout Extension (Plus only)

1.title: Step 1: Creating a preorder selling plan
1.description: What is a selling plan? A selling plan is Shopify's way of scheduling products so they can be fulfilled at a later date, so- to create a preorder you need to create a preorder selling plan. You can do this in two ways with Dropdeck:

steps.1: Create or add a pre-existing preorder selling plan on the product admin page under 'Purchase options', which will assign that product alone to the plan.
steps.2: Create a preorder selling plan for a selection of products or even just a product on Dropdeck's preorder plans page.

1.conclusion: Either way, all you need to supply to Dropdeck here is the 'Release Date' for your preorder product, and optionally the number of units to restrict a customer to.

2.title: Step 2: Setting up your theme to use Dropdeck
2.description: There are two ways to utilise Dropdeck in your theme, both of which require you to head into your theme's customiser to enable Dropdeck's 'app embed'. You can enable app embeds to your theme by visiting to the app embeds areas on the left-hand side toolbar of the customiser. This will offer you two options under the 'Setup Choice' option:

1.title: Simple Setup (Recommended):
1.description: This is the easiest way to setup Dropdeck, once 'Setup Choice' is set to 'Simple Setup' there's nothing else you need to do. The selling plan will automatically be injected into any purchase form on your site. The caveat being that there is a chance this will break some functionality on your theme if your theme has undergone a lot of customisations, or if it's a theme that wasn't developed by Shopify. You can skip step 3 as it only relates to the advanced setup.

2.title: Advanced Setup:
2.description: This step requires technical knowledge of your theme's codebase, it is best to leave this to a developer. Once the 'Setup Choice' is set to 'Advanced Setup' you will need to add the following code snippets into your theme's codebase. This will allow you to control the placement of the preorder selling plan on your site, and also allows you to add additional functionality to the preorder selling plan. Continue to step 3 for more information on how to add the code snippets into your theme's codebase.

3.title: Step 3: Installing code snippets for the advanced setup
3.description: It is best to leave this work to a developer who is familiar with Shopify's infrastructure as only someone with experience will be able to ascertain how each of these snippets will need to be integrated into your theme. Start off by clicking the button below to download the zipped code snippets. Once downloaded, these snippets will need to be added into your theme's codebase in the snippets folder.

1.title: dropdeck-get-sp.liquid
1.description: This snippet is used to return various pieces of data about the preorder selling plan easily.

2.title: dropdeck-sp-input.liquid
2.description: This should be included inside of all forms with the action '/cart/add' in your theme. This applies the preorder selling plan you created to the product.

3.title: dropdeck-release-date.liquid
3.description: This snippet is used to display the release date for a product with a preorder selling plan.

4.title: dropdeck-unit-restriction.liquid
4.description: This snippet is used to display the unit restriction for a product with a preorder selling plan. This should be added to all of the quantity selectors on the theme as the value of the max attribute on the input. This will likely also need integrating with your themes javascript to ensure that the quantity is updated correctly on variant changes.

4.title: Step 4: Adding the Unit Restriction Checkout Extension (Plus only)

description.1: If you are a Shopify Plus user, you can add the Unit Restriction Checkout Extension to your store's checkout to ensure that customers cannot exceed a purchase restriction on a preorder product. This applies the unit restriction not only to their current cart, but across all of their previous order, this functionality which checks a customers previous orders is only available to Shopify Plus customers.
description.2: To add the extension, go to your admin dashboard and visit: Settings > Checkout. Here you will see your 'Configurations', you'll want to 'Customize' the 'Live' configuration. In the customizer for your checkout, under 'Order summary' you should have the option to 'Add app block'. Here you can add the 'Unit Restriction' app block to your checkout. Once added, this extension will automatically apply unit restrictions to any preorder products that have them and that pass through the checkout. If a user exceeds the unit restriction, they will be unable to checkout and will be shown an error message informing them about the restriction.

1.question: The simple setup doesn't work for my theme, what should I do?
1.answer: If the simple setup doesn't work with your theme in that it breaks it or doesn't work as expected, you will need to use the advanced setup. Reach out to us at dropdeck-preorders@proton.me and we'll be happy to help you with setting it up.

2.question: What is a preorder selling plan?
2.answer: A preorder selling plan is a way to schedule a product to be fulfilled at a later date. This is useful for products that are not yet available for sale, but are expected to be released in the future. You can create a preorder selling plan by visiting the preorder selling plans page and clicking the 'Create Preorder Selling Plan' button.

3.question: What is a unit restriction?
3.answer: A unit restriction is a way to limit the number of units a customer can purchase of a preorder product. This is useful for preorder products that you want to facilitate a fair and equitable preorder experience for all customers. If you're a Shopify Plus user, you can add the Unit Restriction Checkout Extension to your store's checkout to ensure that customers cannot exceed a purchase restriction on a preorder product. This applies the unit restriction not only to their current cart which is available to all Shopify users, but across all of their previous orders, this functionality which checks a customer's previous orders is only available to Shopify Plus customers.

4.question: What happens if I have a preorder selling plan setup and I uninstall the app?
4.answer: If you uninstall the app while you have active preorder selling plans they will be removed on uninstall.
